titleStmt.title: Funeral teares For the death of the Right Honorable the Earle of Deuonshire. Figured in seauen songes, whereof sixe are so set forth that the wordes may be exprest by a treble voice alone to the lute and base viole, or else that the meane part may bee added, if any shall affect more fulnesse of parts. The seauenth is made in forme of a dialogue, and can not be sung without two voyces. Inuented by Iohn Coprario.
titleStmt.author: Coperario, John, 1570 (ca.)-1626.

titleStmt.title: Funeral teares For the death of the Right Honorable the Earle of Deuonshire. Figured in seauen songes, whereof sixe are so set forth that the wordes may be exprest by a treble voice alone to the lute and base viole, or else that the meane part may bee added, if any shall affect more fulnesse of parts. The seauenth is made in forme of a dialogue, and can not be sung without two voyces. Inuented by Iohn Coprario.
titleStmt.author: Coperario, John, 1570 (ca.)-1626.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn VVindet the assigne of William Barley, for Iohn Browne, and are to be sold at his shop in S. Dunstons Churchyeard in Fleet street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
